solution_line_template: The garden has space for {num_rows} * {flowers_per_row} = <<{num_rows}*{flowers_per_row}={total_flowers}>>{total_flowers} flowers in total.

Wilma has two times more green flowers than yellow flowers, which means she has {green_multiplier} * {yellow_flowers} = <<{green_multiplier}*{yellow_flowers}={green_flowers}>>{green_flowers} green flowers.
That leaves us with {total_flowers} - {green_flowers} - {yellow_flowers} = <<{total_flowers}-{green_flowers}-{yellow_flowers}={red_flowers}>>{red_flowers} red flowers in the garden.
